parameters.name: AuthResourceList
parameters.description: The information about the resource to be authorized.

parameters.name: ClientId
parameters.description: The application ID registered with the OIDC authentication service.

parameters.name: ClientSecret
parameters.description: The application secret registered with the OIDC authentication service.

parameters.name: CookieDomain
parameters.description: The domain name of the cookie. After the authentication is passed, the cookie is sent to the specified domain name to maintain the logon status. For example, if you set `Cookie-domain` to a.example.com, the cookie is sent to the domain name `a.example.com`. If you set `Cookie-domain` to .example.com, the cookie is sent to all subdomains of `example.com`.

parameters.name: ExternalAuthZJSON
parameters.description: The information about the custom authentication service.

parameters.name: GatewayUniqueId
parameters.description: The unique ID of the gateway.

parameters.name: IsWhite
parameters.description: Specifies whether to enable the whitelist feature.

parameters.name: Issuer
parameters.description: The iss value of JWT claims, which indicates the issuer. You must make sure that the value of this parameter is the same as the iss value in the payload of JWT claims.

parameters.name: Jwks
parameters.description: The JWT public key. The JSON format is supported.

parameters.name: LoginUrl
parameters.description: The URL that is used to log on to the IDaaS instance.

parameters.name: Name
parameters.description: The name.

parameters.name: RedirectUrl
parameters.description: The redirect URL.

parameters.name: ScopesList
parameters.description: The OIDC scope.

parameters.name: Status
parameters.description: The status.

parameters.name: Sub
parameters.description: The sub value of JWT claims, which indicates the subject. You must make sure that the value of this parameter is the same as the sub value in the payload of JWT claims. If you do not set this parameter or leave it empty, the default value, which is the value of the Issuer parameter, is used.

parameters.name: TokenName
parameters.description: The name of the parameter that is required to verify a token. By default, a token is prefixed with Bearer and stored in the authorization header. Example: `Authorization: Bearer token`.

parameters.name: TokenNamePrefix
parameters.description: The name prefix of the parameter that is required to verify a token. By default, a token is prefixed with Bearer and stored in the authorization header. Example: `Authorization: Bearer token`

parameters.name: TokenPass
parameters.description: Specifies whether to enable pass-through.

parameters.name: TokenPosition
parameters.description: The position of the parameter that is required to verify a token. By default, a token is prefixed with Bearer and stored in the authorization header. Example: `Authorization: Bearer token`.

parameters.name: Type
parameters.description: The authentication type. JSON Web Token (JWT) authentication, OpenID Connect (OIDC) authentication, Identity as a Service (IDaaS) authentication, or custom authentication are supported.
